units.yml:
### YamlMime:ModuleUnit
uid: learn.wwl.implement-azure-managed-redis.implement-caching-patterns
metadata:
  title: Implement caching patterns for data access optimization
  description: Apply cache-aside, write-through, and read-through patterns to optimize data access with appropriate eviction policies and TTL strategies
  author: markjulmar
  ms.author: smmark
  ms.date: 01/15/2025
  ms.topic: unit
title: Implement caching patterns for data access optimization
durationInMinutes: 12
content: |
  [!include[](includes/4-implement-caching-patterns.md)]
units.diagramMermaid:
sequenceDiagram
    participant App
    participant Cache
    participant DB
    
    App->>Cache: GET key
    alt Cache Hit
        Cache-->>App: Return cached data
    else Cache Miss
        Cache-->>App: NULL
        App->>DB: Query database
        DB-->>App: Return data
        App->>Cache: SET key data EX 3600
        Cache-->>App: OK
    end
units.diagramCaption: Cache-aside pattern sequence diagram showing application logic for handling cache hits and misses
units.diagramAltText: Sequence diagram illustrating cache-aside pattern flow. Application requests key from cache. On cache hit, data returns immediately. On cache miss, cache returns null, application queries database, receives data, stores in cache with 3600 second TTL, then returns data to caller.

rows: High write throughput, tolerate brief data loss risk

units.comparisonTableCaption: Common caching pattern comparison showing write behavior, consistency guarantees, latency characteristics, and recommended use cases

imageSuggestions.title: Eviction policy behavior under memory pressure
imageSuggestions.description: Visual showing how LRU, LFU, and volatile-TTL eviction policies select different items for removal when cache reaches max memory
imageSuggestions.altText: Diagram showing cache at max memory with six items. LRU policy highlights least recently accessed item. LFU policy highlights least frequently accessed item. Volatile-TTL policy highlights item with shortest remaining TTL. Annotations explain selection criteria for each policy.

videoSuggestions.title: Cache eviction policy demonstration
videoSuggestions.description: Animated visualization showing how LRU, LFU, and TTL-based eviction policies select items for removal under memory pressure with real-time access pattern simulation

interactiveSuggestions.title: TTL and eviction policy calculator
interactiveSuggestions.description: Interactive tool where learners input data volatility (update frequency), access patterns (read/write ratio), and cache size to receive recommended TTL values and eviction policy settings

units.visualAccessibilityNotes: Sequence diagram narrates each step of cache-aside flow with conditional logic for hit versus miss scenarios. Comparison table structures pattern attributes for screen reader navigation.
